result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy R. Koenig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

12 months conditional time to be served consecutive to the prison sentence the Defendant is presently serving. 

Pay costs, including the DNA surcharge.

Obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the agent.  

No contact with the victim (PG) named in the complaint.

Parties stipulate to 0 days credit.

*JOC AMENDED 6-13-16 per Court's on-the-record order of 6-10-16:  Previous language regarding the conditional jail time being served in the prison system has been struck.  Court-ordered language is now as stated above.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

(Specifics described in the main narrative section.)
Consecutive to: prison sentence defendant is presently serving

records.addlTxt: of Conviction - "Defendant approved for release to MSDF Cognitive Program on 3-23-17 and will continue to receive credit toward conditional jail term. Defendant is to return to Richland County Jail upon discharge from MSDF." (cc by clerk to DOC, DA, RCSD, Central Office Cashier Unit)
State
from Def to the Court - request for furlough from jail (request denied by the Court 11-11-16)

Defendant Timothy R. Koenig appears via telephone from Fox Lake Correctional. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA has motioned amendment to JOC, phrase "and to be served in Wisconsin Prison System" be deleted from JOC. Comment by Mr. Koenig.Court notes and denies objection.  Court orders: JOC to be amended "and to be served in the Wisconsin Prison System" shall be deleted from the JOC. Court will also grant work release/Huber privileges if not already granted.
Motion hearing on June 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy R. Koenig
Current: W10237 Lake Emily Road, Fox Lake Correctional Institute, Fox Lake, WI 53933 United States  (Effective: 05-26-2016)
Prior: 307 S. Church Street Apt. 2, Richland Center, WI 53581

Defendant Timothy R. Koenig in court with attorney Lisa A. McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Per DA, Def to plead to count 1 of information for joint recommendation of 5 years initial confinement and 5 years ext. supervision, imposed/stayed for probation of 7 years, consecutive to his current sentence.  Conditions:  12 mo condition time to be served in the WI prison system.  Minimum costs and fines.  DNA sample has been provided.  If surcharge not provided, that's also to be part of the joint recommendation.

Def pleads no contest to the charge stated in the information.  Court's colloquy on plea.

Sentence:  10 years prison with 5 initial confinement and 5 ext. supervision, with that sentence imposed and stayed for probation of 7 years.  Conditions: 12 months conditional time to be served consecutive to prison sentence and in the prison system; costs along with DNA surcharge; obey rules and regs of probation; attend, pay for, and succ. complete any programming ordered by the agent.  Costs as condition of probation.  No contact with victim (PG) named in the complaint.  Parties stipulate to 0 days credit.  Firearms and other felony admonishments given.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

DA Harper and Atty. McDougal.  Def not present; currently in WI prison system.  Atty. M asks to reset the adjourned initial - has not gone over the complaint with def.  Court adjourns this matter to Jan. 14 at 1:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 01-14-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's
Adjourned initial appearance on October 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

DA Harper and Def, in custody and without counsel.  Court confirms def's receipt of the complaint and states the charge, informing def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to counsel.  Def is presently in jail in Sauk County; has return date of Nov. 5; on cash bond and unable to make it.  Def states he has a public defender in the Sauk County case.  Court informs def that he will have to contact the SPD office; instructs court officers to allow def to make a phone call in the other courtroom and then report back to this courtroom.  Adj. to Oct. 29 at 1:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 10-29-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Def reports back that he does qualify for SPD representation.
To produce
Adjourned initial appearance on September 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

DA states that def is incarcerated in another county; no transport was lined up for today as DA was not aware def was in that facility; asks that the initial be adjourned to another date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 09-17-2014 at 01:30 pm.
written minutes
Refused to sign
